publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3931 Sandra White: Glasgow’s MOBO—That the Parliament welcomes the announcement that Glasgow will host the prestigious Music of Black Origin (MOBO) awards, the first time that the iconic awards ceremony has been held outside London in its illustrious 13-year history; applauds the efforts of EventScotland and Glasgow City Marketing Bureau, along with support from the Scottish Government and Scottish Enterprise, in securing the event, and believes that Glasgow’s renowned status as a UNESCO City of Music and world-class venue will be further enhanced by the MOBO awards. Supported by: Rob Gibson*, Stuart McMillan*, Aileen Campbell*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Robin Harper*, Bill Kidd* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-3931 Glasgow’s MOBO (lodged on 21 April 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Anne McLaughlin*, Kenneth Gibson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Bob Doris*
S3M-3931 Glasgow’s MOBO (lodged on 21 April 2009) Elaine Smith*

S3M-3931 Sandra White: Glasgow’s MOBO—That the Parliament welcomes the announcement that Glasgow will host the prestigious Music of Black Origin (MOBO) awards, the first time that the iconic awards ceremony has been held outside London in its illustrious 13-year history; applauds the efforts of EventScotland and Glasgow City Marketing Bureau, along with support from the Scottish Government and Scottish Enterprise, in securing the event, and believes that Glasgow’s renowned status as a UNESCO City of Music and world-class venue will be further enhanced by the MOBO awards. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Stuart McMillan, Aileen Campbell, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Robin Harper, Bill Kidd, Jamie Hepburn, Anne McLaughlin, Kenneth Gibson, Joe FitzPatrick, Bob Doris, Elaine Smith, Jack McConnell*
